definitions.definition: So many as to be incapable of being counted .
examples: The reasons for our failure were as uncountable as the grains of sand on a beach.

definitions.definition: Incapable of being put into one-to-one correspondence with the natural numbers or any subset thereof.
examples: Cantor’s “diagonal proof” shows that the set of real numbers is uncountable .

definitions.definition: That cannot be used freely with numbers or the indefinite article , and therefore usually takes no plural form. Example: information .
examples: Many languages do not distinguish countable nouns from uncountable nouns.
One meaning in law of the usually uncountable noun "information" is used in the plural and is countable.

main_definition: So many as to be incapable of being counted .
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) Incapable of being put into one-to-one correspondence with the natural numbers or any subset thereof.
( grammar , of a noun ) That cannot be used freely with numbers or the indefinite article , and therefore usually takes no plural form. Example: information .
